definitions: The action of saving or being saved from sin, error, or evil.
The action of regaining or gaining possession of something in exchange for payment, or clearing a debt.
The action of exchanging a bond or other security for cash.
The action of fulfilling a promise or pledge.
examples: His path to redemption was long and arduous.
The redemption of the stolen goods required a ransom.
The company announced the redemption of its preference shares.
Her redemption of the vow brought peace to her family.
